official-title.#text:
To amend title II of the Social Security Act to prohibit
		  the inclusion of Social Security account numbers on Medicare
		  cards.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text:
Medicare Identity Theft Prevention Act
			 of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Prohibition of
			 inclusion of Social Security account numbers on Medicare cards

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 205(c)(2)(C) of the Social Security Act

section
			 1414(a)(2) of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1414/ss:a/p:2

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 2(a)(1) of the Social Security Number Protection Act of 2010
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Social Security Number Protection Act of 2010/s:2/ss:a/p:1

text.#text:
by adding at the
			 end the following new clause:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Secretary
				of Health and Human Services

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, shall establish cost-effective procedures to ensure that a Social
				Security account number (or derivative thereof) is not displayed, coded, or
				embedded on the Medicare card issued to an individual who is entitled to
				benefits under

and that any other identifier displayed on such card is not identifiable as a
				Social Security account number (or derivative
				thereof).

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Medicare Identity Theft Prevention Act of 2013/s:2/ss:a/p:3

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall establish a
			 cost-effective process that involves the least amount of disruption to Medicare
			 beneficiaries and health care providers. The
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Secretary of Health and Human Services

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall consider
			 implementing a process, similar to the process involving Railroad Retirement
			 Board beneficiaries, under which a Medicare beneficiary identifier which is not
			 a Social Security account number (or derivative thereof) is used external to
			 the

and is convertible over to a Social
			 Security account number (or derivative thereof) for use internal to such
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Department of Health and Human Services

clause (xiii) of section
			 205(c)(2)(C) of the Social Security Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, shall apply with respect to Medicare cards issued
			 on and after an effective date specified by the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Medicare Identity Theft Prevention Act of 2013/s:2/ss:a/p:3

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, but in no case shall such effective date be later than the date that
			 is 3 years after the date of the enactment of this Act.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Secretary of Health and Human
			 Services

Clause (xiii) of
			 section 205(c)(2)(C) of the Social Security Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Medicare Identity Theft Prevention Act of 2013/s:2/ss:c/p:1

text.#text:
shall provide for
			 the reissuance of Medicare cards that comply with the requirements of such
			 clause not later than 3 years after the effective date specified by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: in such exceptional circumstances as the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Medicare Identity Theft Prevention Act of 2013/s:2/ss:c/p:2/sp:A

text.#text:
may permit an
			 individual to apply for the reissuance of a Medicare card that complies with
